title: Africa: A Two Day International Forum to Boost Investment in Africa Held This Week in Addis Ababa
text:
Zimbabwe: Eliminate Obstacles Hindering Investment 
The World Bank Vice President for Africa, Makthar Diop, highlighted China's experience of dedication, long-term planning, and pragmatism as three major lessons for Africa's industrialization process. Chinese Deputy Minister of Finance, Liu Jianhua, said as Chinese businesses invested abroad and African countries attracted foreign capital, technology, and development experience, there was huge room for cooperation. China, she said, is willing to help Africa build infrastructure network and achieve industrialization by scaling up financial, technological as well as provide human resources support to Africa. 
She said China is planning to set up a $50-million trust fund with the World Bank to support infrastructure development in developing regions including Africa. China's Guangdong Province will host the next Forum in 2016. Africa
